body: Just a "fun" thought about this: this can lead to "data corruption" even when fixed. If someone manages to insert data into the database while having the bug occurring they won't be able to read it once the issue has been fixed and will have to correct the data using direct SQL scripts or possibly even a custom application, depending on the exact converter they have configured.

issue.title: Check value converter configuration source when setting element type

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: [release/8.0] Check value converter configuration source when setting element type.

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32430
Port of #32600

### Description

The convention added in EF 8 configures the matching properties as primitive collections regardless whether they were configured to use a value converter.

### Customer impact

When querying an exception is thrown in some cases, in other cases and when persisting data it is written in an incorrect format, possibly causing data corruption.

### How found

Customer report on 8.0.

### Regression

Yes.

### Testing

Tests added.

### Risk

Low and quirked.
